basics.name: Jiahao Dian
basics.label: Master's Student in Glaciology
basics.summary: Focusing on mountain glacier collapse remote sensing monitoring and subglacial parameter quantitative inversion. Experienced in fieldwork (Qinghai-Tibet Plateau), numerical modeling (Elmer/Ice), and InSAR processing.

work.name: Anyemaqen Glacier Expedition
work.summary: Conducted high-precision UAV photogrammetry for glacier surface morphology; collected bedrock samples; established control points for long-term dynamic monitoring.
highlights: Acquired high-quality surface imagery and samples.

work.name: Tibet Ali Geohazard Investigation
work.summary: Field verification of InSAR deformation results to validate remote sensing data accuracy; investigated potential geohazard sites.

work.name: Anyemaqen Glacier Thickness Survey
work.summary: Used Ground Penetrating Radar (GPR) to measure ice thickness; built 3D glacier models using UAV data.

projects.name: Long-term Remote Sensing & Mechanism of Sedongpu Glacier Collapse
projects.description: Constructed a multi-source remote sensing dataset (Landsat/Sentinel/Planet) covering 20 years (2000-2018). Reconstructed surface velocity fields and thickness changes.
highlights: Quantified abnormal thickening (30m) in the lower reaches (2000-2013).
Proposed a 'Remote Sensing - Inversion - Stability' research framework.

projects.name: Full-Stokes Modeling of Glacier No. 28, Bukadaban Peak
projects.description: Built a thermal-mechanical coupled model using Elmer/Ice to simulate steady-state dynamics and invert basal friction coefficients.
highlights: Validated geometric modeling and mesh generation workflow.
Simulated velocity field consistent with observed data.
Successfully identified basal pressure melting point zones.

awards.title: National Mathematical Modeling Contest
awards.summary: Second Prize (National Level). Led the team in geohazard risk assessment modeling.
